info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 3 at 3:49AM EDT by NWS Northern Indiana
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Northern Indiana has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Ohio...
Blanchard River at Ottawa affecting Putnam County.
Maumee River near Defiance affecting Defiance and Henry Counties.
For the Blanchard River...including Ottawa...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Maumee River...including Fort Wayne, Defiance, Napoleon... Moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Maumee River near Defiance.
* WHEN...From early this morning until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Corner of East First and Auglaize Streets and parts of Second and Hopkins Streets flood.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:15 AM EDT Thursday the stage was 10.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:15 AM EDT Thursday was 10.9 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 13.3 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall early Saturday morning. It will rise to 14.1 feet Sunday morning. It will then fall again but remain above flood stage. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Detailed river forecasts and additional information can be found at www.weather.gov/iwx under Rivers and Lakes.
The next statement will be issued this evening at 1000 PM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE
